alert.note: Alert for City of Fredericksburg; Spotsylvania; Stafford (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 2:06PM EST until January 11 at 3:50AM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Virginia...West Virginia... Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg affecting Spotsylvania, Stafford and City of Fredericksburg independent cities. Opequon Creek near Martinsburg affecting Berkeley and Jefferson Counties. ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Virginia...Maryland...West Virginia... Rappahannock River at Remington affecting Fauquier and Culpeper Counties. Rapidan River Near Culpeper affecting Spotsylvania, Orange and Culpeper Counties. Conococheague Creek at Fairview affecting Washington County. Cacapon River near Great Cacapon affecting Morgan County. ...Observed flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Maryland... Monocacy River near Frederick affecting Frederick County. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Virginia... Rappahannock River above Fredericksburg affecting Spotsylvania, Stafford and City of Fredericksburg independent cities. For the Rappahannock River...including Remington, Fredericksburg, Fredericksburg...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Conococheague Creek...including Fairview...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Monocacy River...including Frederick...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Rappahannock River at Fredericksburg. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 15.0 feet, Old Mill Park in Fredericksburg can no longer be accessed by car due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - There is no current observed data. - Bankfull stage is 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 6.5 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.4 feet on 04/18/2011. - Please visit weather.gov/safety/flood for flood safety and preparedness information && River Name Fld Observed Wed Thu Thu Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time 7PM 1AM 7AM Stg Time Date Rappahannock River Fredericksburg 13.0 MSG unknown 14.8 11.0 8.1 MSG unknown &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/washington or www.weather.gov/baltimore. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 315 PM EST.
